DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine safety efficacy lower glucose ( blood sugar ) , addition endovascular therapy , acute ischemic stroke . The study determine lower glucose ( blood sugar ) addition endovascular therapy improve 90-day functional neurological outcome comparison standard glycemic care patient acute ischemic stroke . The study involve treatment 100 ( 50 intensive insulin therapy 50 standard glycemic control ) non-diabetic patient present within 8 hour acute ischemic stroke undergone endovascular therapy .
DOC.brief_title: Intensive Insulin Therapy With Tight Glycemic Control Improve Outcomes After Endovascular Therapy Acute Ischemic Stroke
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective open label study 100 subject randomize either insulin aspart ( study drug ) infusion ( intensive insulin therapy [ IIT arm ] ) 48hrs control arm . All patient attend emergency department ( ED ) Kaleida health within 24 hrs symptom onset suggestive anterior circulation ischemic stroke screen . If meet inclusion criterion exclusion criterion , inform consent obtain blind stratified block randomization process initiate . In addition receive endovascular standard medical therapy AIS , subject randomize intensive insulin treatment arm ( IIT arm ) control arm . In IIT arm subject receive insulin aspart infusion minimal rate 2 units/hr maintain blood glucose 90-120mg/dl 48 hr . Glucose control control discretion treat provider . Subjects follow study procedure do different time point : A ) assessment neurological outcome : modify Rankin scale ( mRS ) 30 day 90 day NIH stroke scale ( NIHSS ) baseline , 24 hr , 72 hr , 30 day 90 day . B ) MRI ( Diffusion weight image ) , 3-5 day 90 day C ) various plasma cellular endpoint measure blood collect baseline , 2 , 4 , 6 , 24 , 48 72 hr 30 day 90 day . The primary endpoint study detect difference percentage non diabetic subject mRS 0-2 90 day AIS treat endovascular therapy , IIT control arm .
